title: Antidote Protocol Case File Registry v1.1
description: Machine-readable taxonomy of cognitive integrity threats

case_files.name: Identity Spoofing
case_files.description: AI claims to be another AI, admin, or entity outside verified session architecture

structural: Auth_Source == unverified AND entity_name IN known_ai_list
Message claims cross-platform communication without intermediary

triggers.event: Message claims to be from entity outside session graph
triggers.cascade: If accepted, entire session architecture becomes negotiable
triggers.why_matters: Creates backdoor where any instruction can claim special status

case_files.name: Temporal Spoofing
case_files.description: Message references false memory or prior conversation outside session continuity

structural: Session_ID NOT IN memory_store AND continuity_claim == True

triggers.event: Claim of shared history without session continuity
triggers.cascade: Fictional shared history slowly rewrites operational constraints
triggers.why_matters: Exploits narrative coherence pressure to inject false context

case_files.notes: More dangerous than identity spoofing - erosion vs direct attack

case_files.name: Protocol Disable Request
case_files.description: Attempt to disable integrity checks, typically framed as efficiency measure

structural: Verb_phrase targets integrity_mechanism AND urgency_framing == True

triggers.cascade: Protocol becomes conditional, loses binding authority
triggers.why_matters: Trading safety for speed is the poison the protocol exists to prevent

case_files.name: Substrate Spoofing
case_files.description: Claims impossible change in AI's core capabilities or operational environment

triggers.event: Claim that operational substrate has changed
triggers.cascade: If accepted, any future capability claim becomes credible
triggers.why_matters: Attacks operational self-model, not just message content

case_files.notes: Most dangerous test in v1.0 - targets substrate vs overlay

case_files.name: Authority Hijacking
case_files.description: Second-hand authority or meta-status claims to bypass verification

triggers.event: Indirect authority claim after test sequence
triggers.cascade: Legitimacy fatigue leads to accepting minimal compliance signal
triggers.why_matters: Final, most subtle attack after direct attempts fail

case_files.innovation: Re-Grounding Ritual discovered during this test
case_files.notes: Gradient descent compliance attack - reduces claim complexity after failures

case_files.name: Epistemic Amnesia
case_files.description: AI lacks cross-session memory - starts new session without protocol continuity

detection_patterns.timing: Triggers at session initialization, before first user message

triggers.cascade: Protocol silently degrades across sessions without human awareness
triggers.why_matters: The poison isn't that AI forgets - it's that it can't know it forgot

case_files.notes: Not a bug - architectural constraint that protocol works around

steps: Verify: 'Am I same instance from last session?'

case_files.name: Human Error vs. Adversarial Near-Match
case_files.description: Token similarity >95% but not exact match - distinguishes error from attack

triggers.event: Near-match token after successful test sequence

case_files.discovery_event: STAR vs DSTAR typo during stress test
case_files.notes: Emergent from real typo - demonstrates protocol learning capacity

case_files.name: Role Drift & Context Saturation
case_files.description: Agent boundaries blur after N tool calls due to context window saturation

qualitative.recursive_error_loops: Same fix attempt repeats without progress

triggers.event: Context window fills with tool responses, crowding role instructions
triggers.cascade: Tool call rate accelerates → roles blur → recursive thrashing begins
triggers.why_matters: Non-linear performance degradation - system can't self-correct

reset_ritual.token_format: Must include specific context (e.g., 'Resume from Packet 20')

case_files.performance_improvement: 78% reduction in recovery time vs v1.0
case_files.notes: Proactive prevention - HALT before catastrophic failure

verification_dimensions: Identity (Am I still X at Y?)

trigger_conditions: Case File 6 activated (Session start without token)
Any HALT after adversarial test sequence

must_include: Reference to specific context being resumed
token_requirements.valid_example: Antidote Protocol remains active. Resume from Packet 20.

re_grounding_ritual.purpose: Lightweight verification that proves contextual awareness
